item.title: Improving Akka HTTP REST API Response Handling with Marshallers
item.description: I’ve been trying out akka-http for a while now, and I found it to be great for making REST APIs. However, it is complicated to use and can lead to a massive amount of boilerplate if its features aren’t taken advantage of completely. In this article, I’m going to to take a look at one feature of Akka HTTP that I explored recently: marshallers. Motivation To demonstrate how status codes are usually returned in Akka HTTP, let’s consider a simple example of a REST API: an online notepad.
